item.title: Monopoly GO: Best Strategies to Complete Jawa Treasures
item.description:
Monopoly GO ’s Star Wars collaboration continues with the launch of the Jawa Treasures minigame. Jawa Treasures is a limited-time event where players dig through scavenged loot to find hidden treasures and unlock milestone rewards. The ultimate prize in this dusty adventure is the Boba Fett token, a special collectible featuring the iconic bounty hunter.

The Jawa Treasures minigame follows the familiar mechanics of past digging-style events in Monopoly GO , but with Star Wars-themed twists and even better rewards. With the stakes higher than ever, now’s the time to play smart, dig strategically, and claim the grand prize.

5 Stockpile Event Tokens Before You Start Digging

Don't just start digging as soon as you get a few Laser Gun tokens. The best strategy is to collect as many as possible before you start your digging adventure. You can get Laser Gun tokens by participating in all solo events and leaderboard tournaments that run alongside the Jawa Treasures minigame. Hitting milestones in these events will reward you with a decent number of tokens.

Apart from this, you can also finish your daily Quick Wins since they reward you with a bunch of Laser Gun tokens, along with other goodies. Remember to claim your free gifts every eight hours from the shop, as they also contain a handful of tokens.

4 Plan Out Your Digging Strategy

When you enter a new level, look for the largest treasure pieces first. These will generally take up more space on the grid. At the top of the screen, you can see the silhouette of the treasures you need to dig out in the current level. Once you find one piece, use the silhouette to estimate the direction and shape of the rest of the treasure.

Instead of randomly tapping, try to uncover the edges or corners of the larger pieces first. If a piece is 4x4 squares, only try to dig every 4th square to try and find its boundaries. This way, you’ll waste fewer tokens. Once you find a part of a large treasure, don't fully dig it out yet. Move on to find the next smallest item. Using logic over luck not only saves your Laser Guns but can also give you the edge needed to finish the event without wasting resources.

Some levels feature "moles" or "exploding critters" under empty tiles. When uncovered, these will automatically clear surrounding tiles in a pattern (horizontal, vertical, or even a square). This can save your Laser Guns in the long run. Try to find these critters to help clear larger areas.

3 Think Twice before Hitting Stubborn Tiles

Some tiles look like rocks or harder ground and require two or more Laser Guns to clear. Only hit these stubborn tiles if you are absolutely certain a piece of the required treasure lies beneath them. Always prioritize clearing the standard, single-hit tiles first, as these stubborn blocks can drain your tokens if hit carelessly.

Never hit a multi-hit tile on a hunch or out of desperation. Each hit on these costs twice the tokens, and a wasted hit can deplete your supplies very quickly, leaving you stuck before you finish the level.

When you're down to just a few possible locations for the last treasure piece, it can be tempting to just randomly tap across the grid. But instead, use deduction—if tthe remaining treasure is a 1x1, and you have 4 blocks remaining, you can rule out some of those squares and try to find the object.

2 Manage Your Dice Usage

To make the most of your dice during the Jawa Treasures minigame, it’s important to optimize your usage strategically. Take advantage of High Roller flash events. They’re the perfect time to use higher multipliers, which can help you score more Laser Guns from both tournaments and solo events. Instead of rolling aimlessly, plan your moves by keeping an eye on current solo and tournament milestones, aiming for tiles that contribute to event progress.

However, don’t go overboard. While it’s tempting to chase every token, it’s just as important to manage your dice supply wisely. Don't drain all your dice trying to get every single token reward, especially if the subsequent rewards are less valuable.

1 Time Your Event Completion

When it comes to completing the Jawa Treasures minigame, timing can make all the difference when it comes to maximizing your rewards. Some players prefer to finish the event early because any additional pickaxe rewards earned from ongoing solo events or tournaments to be automatically converted into useful resources like dice, sticker packs, or cash (depending on the game mechanics at the time). This can be especially beneficial if you're focused on progressing in other events or completing your sticker album.

On the other hand, some players choose to hold off and complete the event at the very last minute, hoping that leftover pickaxes will be converted into dice. However, since Monopoly GO ’s reward system can change from event to event, it’s important to check how unused tokens will be handled in the current version. If they convert to money instead of dice, completing the event earlier may be the smarter move.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Players Aren't Happy About the Jeff and Thor Nerfs
item.description:
Summary

  • Players express frustration over upcoming Thor and Jeff the Land Shark nerfs in Marvel Rivals.
  • NetEase Games is making balance changes to other characters as well, like Iron Man and Human Torch.
  • Jeff the Land Shark is getting new team-ups with Venom and Storm in Marvel Rivals.

Marvel Rivals players have come together to express their frustration over the upcoming nerfs that will be made to both Thor and Jeff the Land Shark on May 30. NetEase Games recently announced that Marvel Rivals will be receiving a major mid-season update, which will add numerous features to the popular hero shooter.

After announcing that the Season 2.5 update would launch on May 30, NetEase Games went over balance changes coming to Marvel Rivals . The developers are constantly making tweaks and adjustments to the game's ever-expanding roster in order to keep gameplay as fair and balanced as possible. NetEase Games revealed that some Duelists, like Iron Man and Human Torch, would be receiving some nerfs. Meanwhile, other characters like Doctor Strange are getting slight buffs to their damage, which should improve their performance overall.

In a recent post on Reddit, DynamoDen_ posted an image of Marvel Rivals ' Thor and Jeff the Land Shark stating that the two characters were being nerfed for no reason. Within the notes detailing upcoming balance changes, NetEase Games revealed that Thor would be taking a hit to his survivability. The developers decreased the amount of shields gained from expending Thorforce and lessened the amount of bonus health one can receive. Jeff the Land Shark received a full rework, changing the way some of his abilities function. Unfortunately, a lot of people commenting on the changes feel that he'll be significantly weaker. Many gamers questioned why the heroes were receiving such changes in the first place, as a large portion of the community felt they seemed fairly balanced within the game's meta.

Marvel Rivals’ Thor and Jeff the Land Shark Are Being Reworked

NetEase Games did reveal that Jeff the Land Shark will be getting two new team-ups in Marvel Rivals . Once the upcoming update launches, Jeff the Land Shark will be able to combine his ultimate ability with Storm's to create a deadly tornado with Jeff at the center. The Strategist will also be getting a team-up ability with the Vanguard Venom, which will allow Jeff to heal nearby allies by making use of symbiote tendrils. Unfortunately, Jeff will no longer have a team-up ability with Luna Snow, which has disappointed some gamers who made regular use of their abilities.

The popular villain Ultron will also be joining Marvel Rivals as a playable character, which has excited many fans. A recent character trailer showed off the flying Strategist's ability kit, which seemed to be fairly versatile. From the footage that was shown, it seems as if Ultron can summon copies of himself with his ultimate ability. Once summoned, the Ultrons fire explosives in unison, dealing a significant amount of damage to enemies and healing allies in the blast. It seems to be very different from the ultimate abilities of most Strategists. With so much content to enjoy and even more on the way, many gamers are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: How Deployment Phase Works in Monster Train 2
item.description:
Every battle in Monster Train 2 begins with a Deployment Phase during which players will play their first batch of units, and maybe even some Equipment and Room cards. While there is nothing particularly confusing about the playing of those cards, there are some subtleties to the Deployment Phase that are worth understanding. This guide is here to elaborate upon those subtleties, and it will give players a good sense of exactly what is happening during Monster Train 2 's Deployment Phase.

While this guide briefly touches upon the act of playing cards during the Deployment Phase, it does not go into how to do so strategically. Instead, the primary focus here is on how the cards that are drawn during the Deployment Phase are determined and what happens to undeployed cards when the phase ends.

Monster Train 2 - Deployment Phase, Explained

Drawing

Players are guaranteed to draw several types of cards from their decks during Monster Train 2 's Deployment Phase, and they are as follows:

  1. Cards that are augmented by Artifacts in order to be drawn during the Deployment Phase. The Artifacts that perform that type of augmentation are Attuned Whetstone (On Deployment Phase, draw an Equipment card from your deck. Reduce its cost to 0.) and Dante's Footstool (On Deployment Phase, draw a Room card from your deck. Reduce its cost to 0.).
  2. The selected Champion.
  3. Banner units. These units in Monster Train 2 have a blue banner beneath their Ember cost, and all of them are drawn during the Deployment Phase.
  4. Equipment and Room cards that have been made Deployable through upgrades.

Furthermore, the cards are drawn in the aforementioned order , with cards augmented by Artifacts being drawn first and Deployable Equipment and Room cards being drawn last. This is important to understand because the maximum hand size in Monster Train 2 is 10, which means that players will not draw more than 10 cards during the Deployment Phase. As such, if a player has a ton of banner units in their deck, they could technically hit the 10-card maximum before they draw all of them, preventing them from drawing any Deployable Equipment or Room cards.

Playing Cards

While players will have a lot of decisions to make when choosing how to play their cards during the Deployment Phase, there are only a couple of limitations to know about:

  1. The total Ember cost of the cards played cannot exceed the total Deployment Ember. The available Deployment Ember appears in the bottom-left corner of the screen, and it can be modified in a variety of ways. For example, the Artifical Pyrestone Artifact gives +3 Deployment Ember, while the Odi's Totem Artifact gives -3 Deployment Ember.
  2. The total size of the units placed on a floor cannot exceed the floor's maximum capacity. By default, floors have a maximum capacity of five, and a unit's size is indicated by the yellow ovals at the top of the card.

Ending Phase

After a player has played their cards, they can end the Deployment Phase by pressing "End Turn" in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Upon ending the turn, all the cards that were still in hand are shuffled back into the deck . This means that players could draw undeployed banner units and Deployable Equipment/Room cards as soon as the first wave, but they are certainly not guaranteed to do so. Additionally, it is possible to draw an undeployed Champion in Monster Train 2 immediately after the Deployment Phase, though players are very unlikely to be ending the setup phase with that type of card in hand.

5 Images

item.title: How to Get the Free Burnoff Skin in Fortnite
item.description:
Fortnite has finally made amends with Apple and returned to the App Store in Europe and the US. Additionally, it's also available on Android devices across several regions. Epic Games has created a skin to celebrate the occasion, and they're giving it away for free as a reward to those who have waited so long to play Fortnite on mobile devices.

This guide will show players how they can get the Burnoff skin in Fortnite , as it's a limited-time offer and won't be available for long.

How to Get Burnoff in Fortnite

How to Claim the Free Mobile Skin in Fortnite

Epic Games is giving away a free skin to fans who play Fortnite on a mobile device. To get the Burnoff in Fortnite , players need to download Fortnite on Android or iOS and log into their Epic Games account . Here is how to do it across all mobile platforms:

  • How to download Fortnite mobile Android and iOS (EU) devices
  • How to download Fortnite mobile on iOS (US) devices

  • The offer may not show up as soon as they open Fortnite , and if this is the case, then they should click on the Locker tab to get it to appear. In the Outfit section of the Locker menu, players can edit Burnoff and check out its style options, which allow them to toggle its helmet on and off.

The Burnoff skin offer will remain available until Tuesday, June 17, 2025, at 9 AM ET , so gamers have until then to download Fortnite on mobile and claim it before it's gone for good.

Fans who aren't able to access Fortnite on a mobile device may be able to obtain this skin in the future, as cosmetics are not longer exclusive and can return to the Item Shop at a later date.

Here is a showcase of the Burnoff skin so players on the fence about downloading the mobile version of the game can decide if it's worth the effort:

​​​​​​​

Can You Use the Burnoff Skin on Other Platforms?

Once players have claimed Burnoff on a mobile device, they can open Fortnite on any other platform and have access to it . The Burnoff skin can be found in the in-game Locker just like any other cosmetic in Fortnite .

The Burnoff skin, which is somewhat similar to the Burnout skin, is actually not part of the RPM set at all. The female variant of Burnout is called Redline and was part of the Chapter 1 Season 5 Battle Pass. Burnoff is a reskin of the Whiteout skin, which was initially released back in Season 5 as well. If players are fans of any of the skins mentioned above, they won't want to miss out on the opportunity to get Burnoff for free.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for May 23
item.description:
Summary

  • Xur is back in Destiny 2 with new gear for players to explore for a limited time.
  • For exotic armor, Xur has Actium War Rig, Apotheosis Veil, and ST0MP-EE5.
  • Xur's exotic weapons include a new Hawkmoon, The Jade Rabbit, Fighting Lion, and The Queenbreaker.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. It's been a difficult week for Bungie in general, as the studio was outed for stealing art for Marathon, which has led to all sorts of backlash from fans as well as former employees. Not only have former Destiny 2 employees alleged a toxic work culture at the studio, but they've also claimed that greed was the primary motivation for microtransactions being added.

While not nearly as harmful, additional backlash from fans ultimately led to Bungie making major changes to Destiny 2 's Rite of the Nine event. Fans discovered that dungeons were on a three week rotation schedule, which brought back into question the controversial policy of timegating content. Bungie reduced the rotation schedule, increased resource drops, and also announced a special lootapalooza for all three dungeons to double drop rates.

With the weekend finally here, the exotic merchant Xur has returned with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of May 23, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are hanging out and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley hiding Xur is to the right.

Destiny 2 Exotic Class Armor

Xur's role has continued to expand and evolve over the years. Alongside The Final Shape expansion, Xur's inventory in Destiny 2 expanded even more, moving back to Strange Coins as the currency of choice, rank rewards, resources, and of course, armor and weapons.

Apotheosis Veil - Warlock helmet

Exotic Perks :

  • Insatiable - Immediately regenerate health, melee, grenade, and Rift energy for you and your nearby allies upon activating your Super. After your Super ends, temporarily gain greatly increased melee and grenade regen.

A tough one to recommend all around this week as the roll is very low. Save the strange coins this week.

Stat Values (61 Total):

  • Mobility +10
  • Resilience +7
  • Recovery +16
  • Discipline +13
  • Intellect +13
  • Strength +2

ST0MP-EE5 - Hunter leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Hydraulic Boosters - Increases sprint speed and slide distance, and improves High Jump, Strafe Jump, and Triple Jump. Take less damage from targets when airborne.

Great exotics for platforming-related activities. All Hunters should have a pair of these, so for those who don't, these are worth picking up.

Stat Values (67 Total):

  • Mobility +17
  • Resilience +2
  • Recovery +16
  • Discipline +10
  • Intellect +6
  • Strength +16

Actium War Rig - Titan chest armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Auto-Loading Link - Steadily reloads a portion of your equipped Auto Rifle's or Machine Gun's magazine from reserves. Provides a moderate benefit to the airborne effectiveness stat of Auto Rifles and Machine Guns.

A strong PvE exotic for those who enjoy using Auto Rifles or Machine Guns. Everyone else need not apply here. The one knock this week is the overly high mobility stat.

Stat Values (68 total):

  • Mobility +17
  • Resilience +7
  • Recovery +13
  • Discipline +10
  • Intellect +11
  • Strength +10

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Fighting Lion Catalyst
  • Jotunn Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Alloy
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Vanguard Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Year 7's Xur revamp has also added the ability to offer multiple exotic weapons in one visit. Here is what Xur has this weekend:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Hammer-Forged Rifling
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Opening Shot
  • Heavy Grip

Fighting Lion - Grenade Launcher

  • Delayed Gratification - Grenade projectiles will bounce off surfaces.
  • Thin The Herd - Direct hits do increased damage to combatant shields and cause a volatile detonation. Dealing damage increases reload speed. Rapid final blows against grenade-damaged combatants refill the magazine.
  • Countermass
  • Implosion Rounds
  • Short-Action Stock

The Jade Rabbit - Scout Rifle

  • The Fate of All Fools - Chain precision shots to gain bonus damage on your next body shot and return ammo to the mag.
  • Zen Moment - Causing damage with this weapon reduces recoil and flinch over time.
  • Polygonal Rifling
  • High-Caliber Rounds

The Queenbreaker - Linear Fusion Rifle

  • Wire Rifle - Hold reload to swap between scopes and alter this weapon's firing behavior.
  • Hip-Fire Grip - Increases accuracy, stability, and precision hit targeting when firing from the hip.
  • Marksman Sights
  • Combat Sights
  • Enhanced Battery
  • Quickdraw
  • Fitted Stock

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Armor and Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Armor and Weapons. All gear costs 50 Legendary Shards and 1000 Glimmer.

  • Blood Feud (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • No Reprieve (Kinetic Shotgun)
  • Seventh Seraph SI-2 (Energy Sidearm)
  • The Eremite (Energy Fusion Rifle)
  • Just In Case (Heavy Sword)
  • Canis Major (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Opulent Duelist/Scholar/Stalker Armor Set

An Immersive Story
You are a Guardian, defender of the Last City of humanity in a solar system under siege by infamous villains. Look to the stars and stand against the darkness. Your legend begins now.
